  • Afghanistan players made their debut into IPL this time and were bought by Sunrisers Hyderabad.

entry.content:
Ben Stokes bought for Rs. 14.5 Crores

  • In the 10 th IPL auction, Ben Stokes was bought by Rising Pune Supergiants for a whopping Rs. 14.5 Crores.

  • Afghanistan players made their debut into IPL this time and were bought by Sunrisers Hyderabad.

Palaniswami announces a slew of schemes

  • Two days after taking over as the chief minister of Tamil Nadu, Mr. Palaniswami has introduced a slew of schemes targeting farmers and poor people.

Declaration of countries as sponsor of terrorism bill opposed

  • The D eclaration of Countries as S ponsor of Terrorism Bill, 2016 which was moved in Rajya Sabha by independent member Rajeev Chadrasekhar was opposed by the Home Ministry, as it was against Geneva conventions.

Records of Gandhi assanination to be made available

  • Central Information Commission(CIC) has directed National Archives of India(NAI) to post the records related to Gandhi's assassination on the public domain.

NPPA fixes a price cap for stents

  • National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority(NPPA) has fixed a cap for the prices of Stents.

  • The move is to eliminate illicit brokers making the product easily accessible.

Keezhadi excavation to continue

  • Central government has given permission to continue excavation at Keezhadi after a delay of six months.

  • It is expected that Keezhadi hosted the biggest habitation of Sangam dated between 200 BC – 1000 AD

Constitution bench for Sabarimala case

  • A bench of justices has referred the sabarimala case on the issue of ban of women between the ages 10 – 50 into the temple, to a constitutional bench.

CBI books a case against its former chief

  • Central Bureau of Investigation(CBI) has booked a case against its former chief A.P. Singh on the account of graft charges.

Listing process of railway PSEs begins

  • Finance Ministry has started the process of listing the three railway PSEs – IRCTC, IRCON & IRFC through IPO.

  • The expected value though divestment is Rs. 72000 crores.

IFC invests in Granules India

  • World Bank's International Finance Corporation(IFC) has invested $47.5 million in the Hyderabad based Granules India Ltd.

TCS to buy-back 5.61 crore shares

  • TCS board had approved a buy-back of 5.61 crore equity shares accounting up to 2.5% of the total equity share capital for Rs. 16000 crores.

Google, Microsoft to demote piracy sites

  • Google and Microsoft have signed up a voluntary code of practice and they will work parallelly anti-piracy measures.

India to face SA

  • Indian women cricket team will have to face South Africe in the final of the ICC womens world cup qualifying tournment.

47 on trial for Turkey Coup

  • 47 suspects were arrested in Mugla, Turkey for plotting to assassinate Turkish President Erdogen on July 15, 2016.

Artillary increased near Afganistan Border

  • After a series of horrifying attacks, Pakistan has moved heavy artillery towards Afghanistan Border to enhance security arrangements for combating terrorism.

Source: The Hindu

Image Credits: Unsplash

entry.content:
61% polling recorded in 3rd phase in UP

  • 61% polling was recorded in the 3 rd phase polling in Uttar Pradesh .

  • There were 60 seats that went for polling in the 12 districts.

ICMR signs MOU with Monash

  • Indian Council for Medical Research(ICMR) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding(MOU) with Australian university Monash.

  • The research between these institutes will be focussed on combating dengue.

T. R. Zelian steps down as Nagaland CM

  • Nagaland Chief Minster T. R. Zelian has decided to step down because of the ongoing turmoil in the state.

Water scarcity in Bengaluru

  • Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board(BWSSB) has hired around 25 private tankers in order to get out of the water scarcity crisis.

2 maoists killed

  • In an operation by Special Task Force, District Reserve Guard and Telangana;s Greyhounds, 2 maoists belonging to the banned CPI(Moist) were killed in two separate encounters in the Baster region in Chattisgarh.

Altmas Kabir no more

  • Former Chief Justice of India Altmas Kabir died at the age of 68.

  • He served as the 39th Chief Justice of India.

Idea, Vodafone likely to merfe this month

  • Aditya Birla group Idea cellular and Vodafone Idea are likely to merge by this month.

  • The merged entity will have the largest market share and is expected to provide an enhanced customer experience.

Havells buys a unit of Lloyd

  • Havells India Ltd. has agreed to buy a unit of Lloyd Electric and Engineering Ltd. for a $231 million.

Paytm to bring in Rs. 600 crores

  • Paytm is expected to invest Rs. 600 crores in the upcoming months to increase its market share of mobile wallet payments.

Smith is the new RPS captain

  • Steven smith , Australia's Test skipper will be the new Rising Pune Supergaints captain.

  • M. S. Dhoni was the former captain for this team.

Pollock to replace Shastri at ICC

  • Shaun Pollock has been appointed as the representative from the media on the ICC's cricket committee.

  • Ravi Shastri was the former representative for this post.

Failed peace talks between Isreal, Egypt and Jordan

  • Isreali Prime Miniter Benjamin Netanyahu , along with Egyptian President Abdul Fatah-al-Sisi, Jordan's king Abdullah met secretly a year ago to discuss about the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. But the peace talks failed to give an outcome.

Iraqi forces launch ground offensive

  • Iraqi forces have launched a ground offensive over Islāmic State(IS) to dislodge the jihad group from west Mosul.

Source: The Hindu

Image Credits: Wikimedia

entry.title: Day 9: 19 February 2017
entry.summary:
Palaniswami wins confidence votes

  • Palaniswami, 13 th chief minister of Tamil Nadu had proved his confidence vote in the Tamil Nadu legislative Assembly, after a lot of violence by the opposition.

  • Out of 234 seats 122 members voted in favour of Palaniswami.

entry.content:
Palaniswami wins confidence votes

  • Palaniswami, 13 th chief minister of Tamil Nadu had proved his confidence vote in the Tamil Nadu legislative Assembly, after a lot of violence by the opposition.

  • Out of 234 seats 122 members voted in favour of Palaniswami.

Ved Prakash Sharma dies at 62

  • Prominent Hindi novelist Ved Prakash Sharma had died at the age of 62.

  • He has written more than 170 novels.

Hike on power tariff called off

  • Rajasthan government bid to hike the power tariff was called off because of the agitations by farmers.

  • Instead the government announced the subsidy which would cost the government Rs. 500 crores.

TTD loses Rs. 8 per laddu

  • Tirumala Tirupathi Devastanams(TTD) has lost Rs. 200 crores on the sale of laddus.

  • TTD incurs a subsidy of Rs. 8 for every laddu which is sold at Rs. 25.

'Year of Apple' for J&K

  • Jammu & Kashmir chief minister Mehabooba Mufti has declared 2017 as the ' Year of Apple '.

  • Government will provide subsidy and also set up mega mandis to encourage farmers and gain high yields.

TRAI to review tariff policy

  • TRAI will review the tariff policy with regard to various regulatory principles. The review also includes the predatory pricing, promotional offers and other related terms.

Final version of Compensation bill

  • Goods and Service Tax(GST) council had cleared the final version of the compensation bill under which the states which will incur losses for the first five years will be compensated.

  • Meeting was held in Udaipur, Rajasthan.

  • The next meeting is scheduled on March 4-5 in New Delhi.

India gives a good start

  • In the India-Australia test match in which the runs in the 1st innings played by Australia was 469, Indian player Shreyas Iyer made a good progress for the team.

Sandeep Kumar creates a National Record

  • Sandeep Kumar made a National record winning the 50 KM gold in Max Bupa National race walking championship, completing it in 3 hours 55 minutes and 59.05 seconds.

Hindu Marraige Bill approved by Pak. Senate

  • Pakistan senate has passed Hindu Marraige bill which will be sent for further approval from the president.

Hafiz Saeed under ATA

  • Pakistan provisional Punjab governmetn has listed Hafiz Saeed chief of Jamat-ud-Dawa(JuD) under Pakistan's Anti Terrorism Act(ATA) .

Afganistan Pakistan borders closed

  • In the wake of deadliest bomb blasting in Pakistan, Pakistan government has closed the Torkham & Chaman border connecting Pakistan and Afghanistan.

  • Bomb blasts were claimed by Islamic State(IS)

IS business model nearing collapse

  • Self proclaimed Caliphate's Islamic state is in the state of collapsing financially because of the decline in revenue.

China to build floating nuclear reactors

  • China is planning to build floating nuclear reactors to provide electricity for its offshore projects and few islands in South China Sea

  • China's National Development and Reform commission has already approved the project.

Source: The Hindu

Image Credits: Fickr

entry.title: Day 8: 18 February 2017
entry.summary:
Smart fence along India – Pakistan Border

  • The proposal to build a wall along the India-Pakistan border was dropped because the government was looking at more technical solutions.

  • The move is to use sensors, networks, intelligence & command to cut the costs and keep up the operational effectiveness.

National song not a …
entry.content:
Smart fence along India – Pakistan Border

  • The proposal to build a wall along the India-Pakistan border was dropped because the government was looking at more technical solutions.

  • The move is to use sensors, networks, intelligence & command to cut the costs and keep up the operational effectiveness.

National song not a fundamental duty

  • A bench of justices in supreme court had made it clear that Article 51(A) of constitution never mentioned National song as a fundamental duty.

  • The verdict was given for the centre's plans to promote Vande Mataram as National song.

ISRO's GSLV tests successful

  • ISRO chairman A. S. Kiran Kumar along with his colleagues has witnessed the successful test of GSLV MK III's cryogenic upper stage C – 25.

  • GSLVs can carry a payload of about 4 tonnes and ISRO is planning to put a communication satellite into orbit using this Launch Vehicle.

NEET mandatory for all medical exams

  • Central council of Indian Medicine has made it clear that National Eligibility – cum – Entrance Test(NEET) is compulsory for seat in any of the Ayurvedic, Yoga, Naturopathy, Unani, siddha and homeopathy streams.

Aadhaar required for Scholarships

  • Ministry of Human Resources and Development( MHRD) has made Aadhar card mandatory for the meritorious students to avail scholarships.

Minister clarifies Gen. Rawat's statements

  • Minister of State for home affairs in the Prime Minister Office(PMO) Jitendra Singh has made it clear that the Army chief General's statements were concern about the locals and not a sign of warning.

Note presses return to normalcy

  • After the centre's demonetization and remonetization drive, note presses which had worked round the clock had come to normalcy.

  • Security Printing & Minting corporation of India Ltd.( SPMCIL ), Bharatiya Reserve Bank Note Mudran Pvt. Ltd.( BRBNMPL ), Bank Note Paper Mill India Pvt. Ltd . Were employed in printing the new notes.

Ajay Tyagi gets 3 years term at SEBI

  • Ajay Tyagi who was appointed the new SEBI chairman will get a 3 year initial term at SEBI.

Banks to incur Rs. 33 Crores to reset ATMs

  • It is estimated that it would cost Rs. 33 crores for banks to recalibrate their ATM's to accommodate new currency notes.

Apple Inc. to start Assembly soon

  • Technology giant Apple Inc. is planning to assemble its low cost Iphone SE in Bangalore, India soon.

Mahindra Electric launches e20 plus

  • Mahindra Electric has launched an electric car e20 plus with an ex-showroon price in Delhi of Rs. 5.46 Lakhs.

TASL & Raytheon to made stinger air defence missile components

  • Tata Advances s y stems limited (TASL) along with Raytheon has signed a deal to make stinger defence air missile components.

TRAI to review the tariff policy

  • Telecom regulator TRAI will review the tariff policy to make it clear about the promotional offers, predatory pricing and other aspects.

Harika & Padmini make it into pre – quarterfinals

  • Indian chess players Harika & Padmini had made it into pre – quarterfinals in the women's world chess championship held at Tehran.

US – Russia relations reset will continue

  • American president Donald Trump has reiterated that his administration is committed to push for better relations with Russia.

  • Micheal Flynn NSA to Donald Trump had resigned few days back and this has created a political turmoil.

Source: The Hindu

Image Credits: Fickr

entry.title: Day 7: 17 February 2017
entry.summary:
Palaniswami is the 13th chief minister of TN

  • Edappadi K. Palaniswami was sworn in as the chief minister of Tamil Nadu by the Governor Ch. Vidyasagar Rao

  • Mr. Palaniswami said that he will take a floor test to prove his majority in the assembly.

Reliance and Dassault form a …
entry.content:
Palaniswami is the 13th chief minister of TN

  • Edappadi K. Palaniswami was sworn in as the chief minister of Tamil Nadu by the Governor Ch. Vidyasagar Rao

  • Mr. Palaniswami said that he will take a floor test to prove his majority in the assembly.

Reliance and Dassault form a JV

  • French aerospace defence major Dassault has formed a Joint Venture with Reliance Aerostructures Limited for the supply of 36 Rafale fighter jets ordered by India.

  • The new JV is named Dassault Reliance Aerospace Limited(DRAL) with Anil Ambani holding 51% stake and the remaining 49% by Dassault.

Delhi Blasts accused acquitted

  • People who were accused for blasts which occurred on October 29, 2005 in busy places of Delhi killing 80 people and injuring over 200 people were acquitted of all charges.

Diabetic students to get a break during CBSE exams

  • Students with Type – I diabetes will get a break during the CBSE exams.

  • They will be allotted a snacks breaks probably an hour or so into the exam.

Bihar Babus cannot consume liquor even outside the state

  • In an amendment to the new Bihar State Prohibition and Excise Act, 2016 , Bihar Babu's cannot consume liquor even outside the state.

  • Earlier they were prohibited to drink liquor when on duty.

KKNP nuclear power plant synchronized with the grid

  • Kundankulam Nuclear Power Project's( KKNP ) first reactor which was shut down on November 26 was synchronized with the grid.

Vikas Swarup appointed High commissioner to Canada

  • Ministry of External Affairs(MEA) has appointed prominent writer Vikas Swarup as the new High commissioner to Canada.

  • The move is to push better relations with Canada.

Tata Motors and Microsoft ink a deal

  • Tata Motors and Microsoft has inked a deal to make driving more fun and safer.

  • The move is to use AI(Artificial Intelligence), IoT(Internet of Things) and machine learning technologies to make it better for the car users.

Slunwei invests in Truebil

  • Chinese venture capital fund Shunwei Capital has made an investment of $3 million in the pre owned cars startup Truebil.

COA to review Deloitte Audit reports

  • Committee Of Administrators(COA) appointed by the Supreme Court to look into the Financial matters of BCCI will examine the Deloitte reports.

  • Deloitte was appointed by BCCI in 2015 as a part of its transformational project.

Talks on new constitution

  • Sri Lankan government is speeding up its process to introduce new constitution.

  • Sri Lankan president had earlier promised to introduce a new constitution in his election campaign.

Graphene from soya bean

  • Scientists from melbourne have discovered that high quality graphene can be manufactured from soybeans.

Source: The Hindu

Image Credits: Flickr

entry.title: Day 6: 16 February 2017
entry.summary:
ISRO launches 104 satellites at a time

  • ISRO launches 104 satellites at a time with PSLV(Polar Satellite launch vehicle) C-37.

  • Most of the satellites belonged to 6 different nations.

  • With the successful flight PSLV has created a record with 38 successful missions out of 39 missions.

Cloud seeding over …
entry.content:
ISRO launches 104 satellites at a time

  • ISRO launches 104 satellites at a time with PSLV(Polar Satellite launch vehicle) C-37.

  • Most of the satellites belonged to 6 different nations.

  • With the successful flight PSLV has created a record with 38 successful missions out of 39 missions.

Cloud seeding over Maharastra

  • Maharashtra Government in coordination with Indian institute of Tropical Meteorology(IITM) will do cloud seeding to create rain over the drought affected areas.

Nod for Sabarimala Airport

  • Kerala government has given approval for the Sabarimala airport. It will be a Green Field airport.

  • The move is to cut the traffic on the road.

Over 68% polling registered in Uttarakand polling

  • Votes were cast for 628 candidates for 13 districts in the hilly state of Uttarakand.

  • Polling percentage of 68% is till 5PM and the number could even go as high as 70%.

UP phase-2 elections record 65% polling

  • Uttar Pradesh Phase – 2 elections has seen a 65% turnout of the electorate. The data is till 5PM.

  • 67 seats of 11 districts went for polls in phase – 2.

Rawat warns locals not to interfere in operations

  • Army chief General Bipin Rawat has warned civilians not to interfere in regular army operations.

  • Recently due to the interference of locals in weeding out some militants, militants have used this as opportunity and fled away.

In-principle approval for merger of SBI with 5 of its subsidiaries

  • Cabinet has given in-principle approval to merge SBI with State Bank of Bikener and Jaipur, State Bank of Hyderabad, State Bank of Patiala, State Bank of Mysore, State Bank of Travancore.

  • This merger is expected to improve operational efficiency and save Rs. 10,000.

Constitution Bench to hear over Delhi – LG spat

  • A constitution bench will hear the Delhi government appeals on whether the Lieutenant Governor has the unilateral power to administer Delhi.

  • An earlier bench on the same case has given a verdict that Lieutenant governor has the authority over police, land, law and order and services.

Bajaj Vehicles BS – IV complaint

  • Bajaj Auto has said that all its vehicles would comply to BS – IV norms from April 1, 2017.

  • Environmental Pollution Control Authority(EPCA) has set the deadline till April 1, 2017, after which sales of vehicles which don't comply to BS – IV is prohibited.

HAL to issue IPO

  • Hindustan Aeronautics limited(HAL) is planning to divest 10% of its stake via equity and will soon submit documents to stock exchange regulator SEBI.

Rohan Bopanna enters quarterfinals

  • Rohan Bopanna who is on ATP world tour event along with Thomas Berdych in Rotterdam has entered the quarter finals.

Luftansa to name one of its aircrafts “Delhi”

  • Luftansa, the German Airline is planning to name one of its Airbus A380 aircraft “Delhi”

  • Luftansa is planning to increase its market share in India.

Trump criticizes Intelligence agencies

  • American President Donald Trump has criticized the Intelligence agencies NSA and FBI over leaking sensitive information to media.

Referendum over new constitution

  • Sri Lankan Government is planning to introduce a referendum for its new constitution.

  • Sri Lankan President Maitripala Sirisena had promised a new constitution in his election campaign.

Source: The Hindu

Image Source: Wiki commons

entry.title: Day 5: 15 February 2017
entry.summary:
SC convicts Sasikala

  • In a verdict for the 20 year old case, Supreme Court had convicted the former chief minister of Tamil Nadu J Jayalalitha and her aides V K Sasikala, Sudhakaran and ilavarasi for possesion of disproportionate assets.

Rule for National Anthem in cinemas changed

  • Supreme court had made …
entry.content:
SC convicts Sasikala

  • In a verdict for the 20 year old case, Supreme Court had convicted the former chief minister of Tamil Nadu J Jayalalitha and her aides V K Sasikala, Sudhakaran and ilavarasi for possesion of disproportionate assets.

Rule for National Anthem in cinemas changed

  • Supreme court had made a clarification to its November 30 2016, order stating that there is no need for audience to stand up when the national anthem is played as a part of the film.

Bengal's 21st district – Kalimpong.

  • Chief Minister of West Bengal Ms. Mamata Banerje has announced that Kalimpong will become the 21st district of West Bengal

  • It was under the sub division of Darjeeling before the announcement.

IAF inducts Netra

  • IAF has inducted the Airborne Early Warning & Control system (AEWCS) , named Netra which was developed indigenously by DRDO.

20 meter long tunnel found

  • Border Security Force(BSF) has identified a 20m long tunnel originating from Pakistan.

4 militants & 2 soldiers killed in J & K

  • 4 militants and 2 soldiers were killed in two separate encounters in Jammu & Kashmir.

  • Officials have identified the militants as members of Lashkar-e-Taiba(LeT)

TTD estimates Rs. 2858.48 crores revenue

  • Tirumala Tirupati Devastanams(TTD) is estimating a revenue of Rs. 2858.48 crores for its financial year 2017-2018.

A lukewarm start for air show in Bengaluru

  • Claimed as the Asia's premier air show, this year there was a lukewarm response from the public as there were only few people who have attended the air show.

Trade unions oppose overhaul of Factories Act

  • Trade unions have opposed the amendment proposed to the Factories Act of 1948 . The amendment will give the state governments power to set the threshold limit.

  • They have also opposed the online registration of the factories, which will ease entrepreneurs to set up a factory without permission.

Jera buys 10% stake in ReNew

  • Japanese firm JERA had brought a 10% stake in the Indian renewable energy company ReNew .

  • Goldman Sacs, Asian Development bank, Abu Dhabi investment authority(ADIA) are other major stake holders in ReNew.

SpiceJet's profits decline 24.5%

  • Owing to increase in fuel prices and the effect of demonetization, SpiceJet's profits declined 24.5% to Rs. 181 crores in the third quarter.

BCCI financial matters to be checked by COA

  • Committee of Administrators(COA) appointed by Supreme Court will look into the financial matters of the BCCI.

Indian Players set a lower base price

  • For the upcoming 10th IPL season, Indian players have set a lower base price when compared to the previous IPL.

  • The only exception is Ishanth Sharma whose base price is Rs. 2 crores.

India makes a slow start

  • In the under 19 test match, India has made a slow start against England.

NSA chief resigns

  • National Security Advisor(NSA) to Donald Trump, Micheal Flynn had resigned on account of allegations levelled against him in regards to contacts with Russia.

Kim Jong Nam assasinated

  • North Korean leader Kim Jong-un 's half brother Kim Jong nam has been assassinated in Malaysia.

Source: The Hindu

Image Credits: Flickr

entry.title: Day 4: 14 February 2017
entry.summary:
Reliance to service US Navy Ships

  • Anil Ambani led Reliance defence Engineering Ltd. had partnered with US Navy to service and maintain the vessels of its seventh fleet consisting of 100 vessels.

  • Reliance defence shipyard is located at Pipanav in Gujarat.

Karnataka amends PCA act

entry.content:
Reliance to service US Navy Ships

  • Anil Ambani led Reliance defence Engineering Ltd. had partnered with US Navy to service and maintain the vessels of its seventh fleet consisting of 100 vessels.

  • Reliance defence shipyard is located at Pipanav in Gujarat.

Karnataka amends PCA act

  • Karnataka government has made its amendment to the Protection of Cruelty to Animals act 1960 to allow kambla and bullock cart racing.

  • Governer is yet to refer the bill to the president of India.

Verdict on Vypak Scam

  • Supreme court comprising of Chief Justice J S Khehar and justices Kurian joseph and Arun Mishra have given a verdict on Vypam scam to cancel the admissions given to 634 students.

Centre is planning to ask states to set the factories threshold limit

  • Central government is planning to push the burden of overhauling the F actories Act of 1948 on the state governments to set the threshold limit.

  • At present, the Factories Act of 1948 recognizes an establishment with 10 or more workers and using electricity or 20 or more workers and not using electricity as a factory.

L&T, european firm to make missiles

  • L&T has partnered with a european firm MBDA missile systems for making missile in India.

  • L&T will hold 51% stake in the Joint Venture and remaining 49% stake will be owned by MBDA missile systems.

Zimbabwe looses to India

  • Zimbabwe which made 60 runs in 28.5 overs lost to I ndia in ICC women's world cup qualifier in Colombo, Sri Lanka.

Bangladesh looses to India

  • India has won the Paytm one – off cricket test match.

  • Bangladesh lost by 208 runs.

Islamabad HC bans Valentine's day events

  • In a ruling, Islamabad High Court had banned the Valentine's day events stating them as unIslamic.

Tensions escalate on North Korea's missile test

  • China had asked all the other countries to focus on other factors over North Korea's behaviour and not just bringing the pressure on Beijing. On February 12, 2017 North Korea had tested a ballistic missile which the North Korean government termed successful.

Saeed is planning to float a political party

  • UN – designated terrorist Hafiz Saeed is planning to start a political party for his group Jamma'at – ud – Dawa(JuD).

  • The main plan is to prevent the cadre from shifting to other Islamic groups like IS.

La La Land fails, but Dev Patel bad an award at Bafta

  • La La Land which was expected to get an award at Britain's Bafta failed to get an award. On the other hand Indian Hollywood actor Dev Patel secured one.

  • Dev Patel was awarded for his supporting character in the movie Lion.

Source: The Hindu Image Credits: Flickr

entry.summary:
2 soldiers and 4 militants die in a new fire exchange

  • Of the 4 militants encountered, 2 of them belong to Hizbul Mujahideen and 2 others belong to Lashker-e-Taiba(L-eT)

  • Encounter took place in Kulgam, 70 KM to the south of Srinagar.

Nobel Burglary case cracked

entry.content:
2 soldiers and 4 militants die in a new fire exchange

  • Of the 4 militants encountered, 2 of them belong to Hizbul Mujahideen and 2 others belong to Lashker-e-Taiba(L-eT)

  • Encounter took place in Kulgam, 70 KM to the south of Srinagar.

Nobel Burglary case cracked

  • Three days afer burglary in Nobel peace Laureate Kailash Satyarthi's apartment, Delhi police had cracked the case.

Plan to appoint single-point military advisor

  • Prime Minister Office is planning to appoint a single-point military advisor to obtain a better coordination between the armed forces.

  • The plan is to put a better framework first before the officer is appointed.

Chennai Oil spill reaches Mamallapuram

  • Chennai oil spill had reached the UNESCO world heritage site Mamallapuram(Mahabalipuram).

  • On January 28, 2017, two ships collided at the Kamarajar port causing a massive oil spill in the sea of the coast of Chennai.

Sathanur dam opened

  • Sathanur dam in Tiruvannamalai district of Tamil Nadu was opened by the district collector Prashant M Wadnere.

Centre to invest in Tech. Startups

  • Centre is planning to invest Rs. 2200 crores by 2019 in startups working on new technologies.

  • The investment will be made under the Electronic Development Fund(EDF).

Vikram Limaye – new CEO and MD of NSE

  • NSE has proposed Rs. 8 crore package for its new chief Vikram Limaye.

  • Chitra Ramakrishna is the present chief of NSE.

Indradanush 2.0 – plan to recapitalize PSB

  • Government is planning to introduce 'Indradanush 2.0' to recapitalize Public Sector Banks.

  • This will be done after the Asset Quality Review(AQR) by Reserve Bank of India(RBI).

R. Ashwin creates a new record

  • Of the 45 test matches played by Ravichandran Ashwin, the 30 year old had bagged the fastest 250 wickets record.

India wins the T20 World's cup for blind

  • India defeated Pakistan in the final of the T20 world cup for Blind.

  • Match was held at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bangalore.

India wins badminton tournment

  • Indian duo comprising of Arjun Mandatil Ravichandran and Ravichandran Shlok had won the Iran Fajr badminton tournament held at Tehran on February 12, 2017.

World Women's chess championship

  • Padmini Rout had made into the ' Round of 32 ' after a draw with Armenia's Elina Danielian at the World Women's chess championship held at Tehran.

North Korea test fires ballistic missile

  • North Korea has t est fired a ballistic missile which landed into the waters of Japan.

  • Japan's prime minister Shinzo Abe had condemned the test.

Steinmeier is the new German President

  • Frank Walter Steinmeir was elected as the new president of Germany .

  • He was the former foreign minister for Germany.

  • He will assume office from 19 March 2017.

Taniguchi Dies at 69

  • Famours Manga legend and cartoon artist Taniguchi died in Tokyo at the age of 69.

La La Land makes into Britain's Bafta

  • La La Land, a musical love story which had a victory at Golden Globe awards has made its way into Britain's Bafta.

Source: The Hindu Image Credits: Alpha Coders

  • 64% polling has been recorded in first phase. 2.59 crore citizens utilized their Right to Vote .

Solar Power on INS Sarvekshak

  • INS Sarvekshak has been installed with a 5.4KW solar power system for generating a share of power required on-board.

  • This will replace diesel alternator which has been generating 4.4KW power thus reducing the carbon footprint by 60 tonnes.

Vijay Joshi to replace MK Razdan as PTI editor-in-chief

  • Senior Journalist Vijay Jo shi has been appointed as the new Editor-in-chief by Press Trust of India (PTI).

  • His predecessor was MK Razdan.

Interceptor missile test successful

  • Developed indigenously by DRDO, interceptor missile was successfully tested on February 11, 2017.

  • This missile comes under the class of Indian Ballastic Missile Defence ( BMD ).

  • This missile can destroy threats from exo and endo atmospheres.

  • At present only 4 nations in the world have this capability.

Five names for the post of SC Judges

  • Union Law Ministry has given 5 names for the appointment of Supreme Court Judges.

  • They are:

    • Naveen Sinha (Chief Justice of the Rajastan High Court)

    • M Santhanagouder (Chief Justice of the Kerla High Court)

    • Dipak Gupta (Chief Justice of the Chattisgarh High Court)

    • S K Kaul (Chief Justice of the Madra s High Court)

    • Justice Abdul Nazeer (Karnataka High court)

LIC increases its shareholding in Infosys to 7.02%

  • Life Insurance Corporation(LIC) has increased its shareholdings in Infosys amidst the ongoing tensions within Infosys current board.

C K Birla Group Firm sells Ambassador

  • Hindustan Motors owned by C K Birla Group has inked a deal to sell Ambassador to European Auto major Peugeot for 80 crores.

ITC eyes on Health Care

  • ITC Ltd. Is planning to enter health care by setting up mutli-speciality hospitals.

Rcom and Idea post losses because of Jio

  • Reliance communications and I dea cellular have posted a net loss for the quarter ending December 2016 mainly due to the promotional offers being offered by Reliance Jio.

New batting coach for Kings XI Punjab

  • J Arun Kumar has been appointed as the batting coach for Kings XI Punjab.

New executive order on Immigration – USA

  • Donal Trump administration might consider a new executive order for the controversial immigration order banning people from seven Muslim-Majority states.

  • The move might be to win the legal battle.

China expels Korean Christian missionaries

  • China has expelled 32 missionaries from South Korea which have done their work in China for over a decade now.

  • It is being widely believed that this is China's retaliation against Seoul's plan to host Terminal High Altitude Area Defence(THAAD).

entry.content:
Shatabdis to get paintings by disabled artists

  • Mumbai-Ahmedabad shatabdi trains will get paintings made using the brushed by disabled artists with their feet.

  • These artists belong to India Mouth and Foot Painting Artists(IMFPA)

  • The paintings are not original and are high quality digital prints.

National Women's Parliament starts

  • National Women's Parliament , a three-day event to empower women to take part in many fields including politics kickstarted on February 10 2017.

  • Venkaiah Naidu, N Chandra Babu Naidu, Dalai Lama, Kiran Bedi and few other notable public figures presided the event.

Sudha Murthy appointed member of TTD board

  • Sudha murthy has been appointed the new member of TTD (Tirumala Tirupathi Devasthanams). Her predecessor was Sekhar Reddy.

  • She is a writer, philanthropist, member of Gates foundation

GK Reddy Memorial Award for Thapar

  • GK Reddy memorial award is awarded to journalists for their excellence in journalism.

  • GK Reddy Memorial award for 2016 goes to Kiran Thapar. Sonia Gandhi will present the award to the nominee.

Ajay Tyagi – Next SEBI chairman

  • Ajay Tyagi has been appointed as the next SEBI Chairman. He is a Senior IAS officer who is an additional secreatary in the department of Economic Affairs.

  • U K Sinha the present chairman term ends on March 1st 2017.

No news on FM – Centre asks SC

  • Centre has filed an affidavit with Supreme Court asking it not to give permission to private FM stations for airing news. Centre wants the news only to be aired by All India Radio.

  • There are 281 FM stations in 84 cities across the country.

SBI opens 1 crore accounts during demonetisation

  • State Bank of India has opened 1 crore accounts, about 1 lakh accounts on an average every day during its third quarter.

  • Profits rose 135% to Rs. 2610 Crores for third quarter.

Aditi Ashok slips to 22nd place

  • 18 year old Indian golf player has slipped to 22 nd place from 13th place after the Oates Vic Open cup .

Solar tarrifs as low as Rs. 2.97/unit

  • Solar tariff had hit a record low of Rs.2.87/unit at an auction for the Rewa Solar Power Plant in Maharastra.

  • Rewa Solar Power Plant consisting of 3 units, of which an auction of Rs. 2.979, Rs. 2.97, Rs. 2.974 were recorded for Units 1, 2, 3 respectively.

Trump upholds 'One-China' Policy

  • In a call with his Chinese counterpart President Xi Jinping, Amercian president Donald Trump had endorsed One-China Policy.

Chaste Lovers to open on eve of Valentine's day

  • Chaste lovers a 2000 years old archeological site in Rome will be opened on Feb 14 for Valentine's day, after which it will be closed for four years for restoration.
